properties.name: -s2-mix-blend-mode

values.name: normal
values.description: With alpha blending

properties.syntax: normal | multiply | screen | additive | SRGBadditive | opaque
properties.description: Controls blending mode for the panel.

properties.name: align

values.name: bottom
values.description: Align the bottom edge of the extended inline box with the bottom-edge of the line box.

values.name: center
values.description: Align the center baseline of the inline element with the center baseline of the parent.

values.name: center_nopixelsnap
values.description: Align the center baseline of the inline element with the center baseline of the parent, but does not round to an integer (pixel).

values.name: middle
values.description: Align the center baseline of the inline element with the center baseline of the parent.

values.name: top
values.description: Align the top edge of the extended inline box with the top-edge of the line box.

values.name: left
values.description: Align the left edge of the extended inline box with the left-edge of the line box.

values.name: right
values.description: Align the right edge of the extended inline box with the right-edge of the line box.

properties.description: Affects the horizontal and vertical positioning of the inline boxes generated by an inline-level element inside a line box.

properties.name: animation

values.name: alternate
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

values.name: alternate-reverse
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

values.name: backwards
values.description: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

values.name: both
values.description: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: forwards
values.description: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

values.name: infinite
values.description: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

values.name: none
values.description: No animation is performed

values.name: normal
values.description: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.description: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

properties.description: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

properties.name: animation-delay
properties.description: Defines when the animation will start.

properties.name: animation-direction

values.name: alternate
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

values.name: alternate-reverse
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

values.name: normal
values.description: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.description: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

properties.description: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

properties.name: animation-duration
properties.description: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

properties.name: animation-fill-mode

values.name: backwards
values.description: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

values.name: both
values.description: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: forwards
values.description: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

values.name: none
values.description: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

properties.description: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

properties.name: animation-iteration-count

values.name: infinite
values.description: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

properties.description: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

properties.name: animation-name

values.name: none
values.description: No animation is performed

properties.description: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

properties.name: animation-timing-function
properties.description: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration.

properties.name: background-color
properties.description: Sets the background color of an element.

properties.name: background-image

values.name: none
values.description: Counts as an image layer but draws nothing.

properties.description: Sets the background image(s) of an element.

properties.name: background-img-opacity
properties.description: Sets the background image's opacity (0-1).

properties.name: background-position
properties.description: Specifies the initial position of the background image(s) (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

properties.name: background-repeat

values.name: repeat
values.description: (default) Repeats in the specified direction until it fills the panel.

values.name: space
values.description: Repeats as many times as required to fill the panel w/o being clipped. Space is added between images to to align first and last image with panel edges.

values.name: round
values.description: Repeats as many times as required to fill the panel w/o being clipped. The image is resized to align first and last image with panel edges.

values.name: no-repeat
values.description: Not repeated.

values.name: repeat-x
values.description: Single value that is equivalent to 'repeat no-repeat'

values.name: repeat-y
values.description: Single value that is equivalent to 'no-repeat repeat'

properties.description: Specifies how background images are tiled after they have been sized and positioned.

properties.name: background-size

values.name: auto
values.description: Preserves the image's aspect ratio.

properties.description: Specifies the size of the background images.

properties.name: blur
properties.description: Sets the amount of blur to apply to the panel and all it's children during composition. Default is no blur, for now Gaussian is the only blur type and takes a horizontal standard deviation, vertical standard deviation, and number of passes.

properties.name: border
properties.description: Shorthand property for setting border width, style, and color.

properties.name: border-bottom
properties.description: Shorthand property for setting border width, style and color.

properties.name: border-bottom-color
properties.description: Sets the color of the bottom border.

properties.name: border-bottom-left-radius
properties.description: Defines the radii of the bottom left outer border edge.

properties.name: border-bottom-right-radius
properties.description: Defines the radii of the bottom right outer border edge.

properties.name: border-bottom-style
properties.description: Sets the style of the bottom border.

properties.name: border-bottom-width
properties.description: Sets the thickness of the bottom border.

properties.name: border-color
properties.description: The color of the border around all four edges of an element.

properties.name: border-left
properties.description: Shorthand property for setting border width, style and color

properties.name: border-left-color
properties.description: Sets the color of the left border.

properties.name: border-left-style
properties.description: Sets the style of the left border.

properties.name: border-left-width
properties.description: Sets the thickness of the left border.

properties.name: border-radius
properties.description: Defines the radii of the outer border edge.

properties.name: border-right
properties.description: Shorthand property for setting border width, style and color

properties.name: border-right-color
properties.description: Sets the color of the right border.

properties.name: border-right-style
properties.description: Sets the style of the right border.

properties.name: border-right-width
properties.description: Sets the thickness of the right border.

properties.name: border-style
properties.description: The style of the border around edges of an element.

properties.name: border-top
properties.description: Shorthand property for setting border width, style and color

properties.name: border-top-color
properties.description: Sets the color of the top border.

properties.name: border-top-left-radius
properties.description: Defines the radii of the top left outer border edge.

properties.name: border-top-right-radius
properties.description: Defines the radii of the top right outer border edge.

properties.name: border-top-style
properties.description: Sets the style of the top border.

properties.name: border-top-width
properties.description: Sets the thickness of the top border.

properties.name: border-width
properties.description: Shorthand that sets the four 'border-*-width' properties. If it has four values, they set top, right, bottom and left in that order. If left is missing, it is the same as right; if bottom is missing, it is the same as top; if right is missing, it is the same as top.

properties.name: box-shadow

values.name: inset
values.description: Changes the drop shadow from an outer shadow (one that shadows the box onto the canvas, as if it were lifted above the canvas) to an inner shadow (one that shadows the canvas onto the box, as if the box were cut out of the canvas and shifted behind it).

values.name: filled
values.description: Normal box shadow but filled.

values.name: none
values.description: No shadow.

properties.description: Attaches one or more drop-shadows to the box. The property is a comma-separated list of shadows, each specified by 2-4 length values, an optional color, and an optional 'inset' keyword. Omitted lengths are 0; omitted colors are a user agent chosen color.

properties.name: brightness
properties.description: Sets the brightness that applies to the panel and all it's children during composition. The value is a multiplier on the HSB brightness value.

properties.name: clip

values.name: rect()
values.description: Specifies offsets from the edges of the border box.

values.name: radial()
values.description: Specifies offsets from the edges of the border box in a radius, which takes a center point, start angle and angular width of the revealed sector.

properties.description: Specifies a clip region within the panel, where contents will be clipped at render time. This clipping has no impact on layout, and is fast and supported for transitions/animations.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Sets the foreground fill color/gradient/combination for a panel. This color is the color used to render text within the panel.

properties.name: context-menu-arrow-position
properties.description: Specifies where to point the arrow of a context menu at on this panel. The first value controls how the arrow is positioned horizontally when the context menu is to the top or bottom of the panel, and the second value controls how the arrow is positioned vertically when the context menu is to the left or right of the panel. Default is '50% 50%'.

properties.name: context-menu-body-position
properties.description: Specifies where to position the body of a context menu relative to this panel.

properties.name: context-menu-position
properties.description: Specifies where to position a context menu relative to this panel.

properties.name: contrast
properties.description: Sets the contrast that applies to the panel and all it's children during composition.

properties.name: flow-children

values.name: none
values.description: Children will have to position themselves.

properties.description: Controls the direction for the children of the panel to flow.

properties.name: font-family

values.name: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif
Cambria, Cochin, Georgia, Times, 'Times New Roman', serif
'Gill Sans', 'Gill Sans MT', Calibri, 'Trebuchet MS', sans-serif
'Lucida Sans', 'Lucida Sans Regular', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif
'Trebuchet MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans', Arial, sans-serif

properties.description: Specifies a prioritized list of font family names or generic family names. A user agent iterates through the list of family names until it matches an available font that contains a glyph for the character to be rendered.

properties.name: font-size
properties.description: Indicates the desired height of glyphs from the font.

properties.name: font-style

values.name: italic
values.description: Selects a font that is labeled as an 'italic' face, or an 'oblique' face if one is not

values.name: normal
values.description: Selects a face that is classified as 'normal'.

properties.description: Allows italic faces to be selected.

properties.name: font-weight

values.description: Thin
Extra Light (Ultra Light)
Light
Normal
Medium
Semi Bold (Demi Bold)
Bold
Extra Bold (Ultra Bold)
Black (Heavy)

values.name: thin
values.description: Same as 100

values.name: light
values.description: Same as 300

values.name: normal
values.description: Same as 400

values.name: medium
values.description: Same as 500

values.name: bold
values.description: Same as 700

values.name: black
values.description: Same as 900

properties.description: Specifies weight of glyphs in the font, their degree of blackness or stroke thickness.

properties.name: height

values.name: fit-children
values.description: (default) Panel size is set to the required size of all children. Can be specified in pixels or percentage.

values.name: fill-parent-flow()
values.description: (default) Fills to remaining parent height. If multiple children are set to this value, weight is used to determine final height.

values.name: width-percentage()
values.description: (default) Percentage of the panel's width, which allows you to enforce a particular aspect ratio.

properties.description: Specifies the height of the content area, padding area or border area (depending on 'box-sizing') of certain boxes.

properties.name: horizontal-align

values.name: center
values.description: Align the center baseline of the inline element with the center baseline of the parent.

values.name: center_nopixelsnap
values.description: Align the center baseline of the inline element with the center baseline of the parent, but does not round to an integer (pixel).

values.name: middle
values.description: Align the center baseline of the inline element with the center baseline of the parent.

values.name: left
values.description: Align the left edge of the extended inline box with the left-edge of the line box.

values.name: right
values.description: Align the right edge of the extended inline box with the right-edge of the line box.

properties.description: Controls the horizontal alignment of content.

properties.name: hue-rotation
properties.description: Sets the hue rotation to apply to the panel and all it's children during composition.

properties.name: img-shadow
properties.description: Specifies image shadows. The shadow shape will match the image the panel can generate,and this is only meaningful for images.

properties.name: letter-spacing

values.name: normal
values.description: The spacing is the normal spacing for the current font. It is typically zero-length.

properties.description: Specifies the minimum, maximum, and optimal spacing between grapheme clusters.

properties.name: line-height
properties.description: Specifies the line height (distance between top edge of line above and line below) to use for text. By default this is unset and a value that matches the font-size reasonably will be used automatically.

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits.

properties.name: margin-bottom
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits..

properties.name: margin-left
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits..

properties.name: margin-right
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits..

properties.name: margin-top
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits..

properties.name: max-height

values.name: fit-children
values.description: (default) Panel size is set to the required size of all children. Can be specified in pixels or percentage.

values.name: fill-parent-flow()
values.description: (default) Fills to remaining parent height. If multiple children are set to this value, weight is used to determine final height.

values.name: width-percentage()
values.description: (default) Percentage of the panel's width, which allows you to enforce a particular aspect ratio.

properties.description: Allows authors to constrain content height to a certain range.

properties.name: max-width

values.name: fit-children
values.description: (default) Panel size is set to the required size of all children. Can be specified in pixels or percentage.

values.name: fill-parent-flow()
values.description: (default) Fills to remaining parent height. If multiple children are set to this value, weight is used to determine final height.

values.name: height-percentage()
values.description: (default) Percentage of the panel's height, which allows you to enforce a particular aspect ratio.

properties.description: Allows authors to constrain content width to a certain range.

properties.name: min-height

values.name: fit-children
values.description: (default) Panel size is set to the required size of all children. Can be specified in pixels or percentage.

values.name: fill-parent-flow()
values.description: (default) Fills to remaining parent height. If multiple children are set to this value, weight is used to determine final height.

values.name: width-percentage()
values.description: (default) Percentage of the panel's width, which allows you to enforce a particular aspect ratio.

properties.description: Allows authors to constrain content height to a certain range.

properties.name: min-width

values.name: fit-children
values.description: (default) Panel size is set to the required size of all children. Can be specified in pixels or percentage.

values.name: fill-parent-flow()
values.description: (default) Fills to remaining parent height. If multiple children are set to this value, weight is used to determine final height.

values.name: height-percentage()
values.description: (default) Percentage of the panel's height, which allows you to enforce a particular aspect ratio.

properties.description: Allows authors to constrain content width to a certain range.

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: Sets the opacity or amount of transparency applied to the panel and all it's children during composition.

properties.name: opacity-mask
properties.description: Applies an image as an opacity mask that stretches to the panel bounds and fades out it's content based on the alpha channel. The second float value is an optional opacity value for the mask itself, the image won't interpolate/cross-fade, but you can animate the opacity to fade the mask in/out.

properties.name: opacity-mask-scroll-down
properties.description: Overrides opacity-mask when the panel can scroll down, based on the overflow property, or when the height of the content in the panel is larger than the height of its layout.

properties.name: opacity-mask-scroll-up
properties.description: Overrides opacity-mask when the panel can scroll up, based on the overflow property.

properties.name: opacity-mask-scroll-up-down
properties.description: Overrides opacity-mask when the panel can scroll up and down, based on the overflow property.

properties.name: overflow

values.name: squish
values.description: (default) Children are squished to fit within the panel's bounds if needed.

values.name: clip
values.description: Children maintain their desired size but their contents are clipped.

values.name: scroll
values.description: Children maintain their desired size and a scrollbar is added to this panel.

values.name: noclip
values.description: Children maintain their desired size and content is allowed to overflow this panel.

properties.description: Shorthand for setting 'overflow-x' and 'overflow-y'.

properties.name: padding
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

properties.name: padding-bottom
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

properties.name: padding-left
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

properties.name: padding-right
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

properties.name: padding-top
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

properties.name: perspective
properties.description: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

properties.name: perspective-origin
properties.description: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Sets the x, y, and z position for a panel, in pixels or percentage. Must not be in a flowing layout.

properties.name: pre-transform-rotate2d
properties.description: Sets 2 dimensional rotation degrees that apply to the quad for this panel prior to 3 dimensional transforms. This rotation applies without perspective and leaves the panel centered at the same spot as it started.

properties.name: pre-transform-scale2d
properties.description: Sets 2 dimensional X/Y scale factors that apply to the quad for this panel prior to 3 dimensional transforms. This scaling applies without perspective and leaves the panel centered at the same spot as it started.

properties.name: saturation
properties.description: Sets the amount of saturation to apply to the panel and all it's children during composition.

properties.name: sound
properties.description: Specifies a sound name to play when this selector is applied.

properties.name: sound-out
properties.description: Specifies a sound name to play when this selector is removed.

properties.name: sound-trans
properties.description: Specifies a sound name to play when this selector is applied and the value was previously set.

properties.name: text-align

values.name: center
values.description: The inline contents are centered within the panel.

values.name: left
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the panel.

values.name: right
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the panel.

properties.description: Describes how inline contents of a block are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill the line box.

properties.name: text-decoration

values.name: none
values.description: Produces no line.

values.name: underline
values.description: Each line of text is underlined.

values.name: line-through
values.description: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

properties.description: Decorations applied to font used for an element's text.

properties.name: text-overflow

values.name: clip
values.description: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.

values.name: ellipsis
values.description: Render an ellipsis (...) to represent clipped inline content.

values.name: shrink
values.description: Lower font size to fit inline content.

values.name: noclip
values.description: Allows the text to overflow based on the overflow style.

properties.description: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping.

properties.name: text-shadow

values.name: none
values.description: No shadow.

properties.description: Specifies text shadows. The shadow shape will match the text the panel can generate,and this is only meaningful for labels.

properties.name: text-shadow-fast

values.name: none
values.description: No shadow.

properties.description: Specifies basic text drop shadows for fast rendering.

properties.name: text-transform

values.name: lowercase
values.description: Puts all letters in lowercase.

values.name: none
values.description: No effects.

values.name: uppercase
values.description: Puts all letters in uppercase.

properties.description: Controls capitalization effects of an elements text.

properties.name: texture-sampling

values.name: alpha-only
values.description: Uses the textures alpha data across all 3 color channels.

properties.description: Controls texture sampling mode for the panel. Set to alpha-only to use the textures alpha data across all 3 color channels.

properties.name: tooltip-arrow-position
properties.description: Specifies where to point the arrow of a tooltip at on this panel. The first value controls how the arrow is positioned horizontally when the tooltip is to the top or bottom of the panel, and the second value controls how the arrow is positioned vertically when the tooltip is to the left or right of the panel.

properties.name: tooltip-body-position
properties.description: Specifies where to position the body of a tooltip relative to this panel. The first value controls how the body is aligned horizontally when the tooltip is to the top or bottom of the panel, and the second value controls how the body is aligned vertically when the tooltip is to the left or right of the panel. 0% means left/top aligned, 50% means center/middle aligned, and 100% means right/bottom aligned.

properties.name: tooltip-position
properties.description: Specifies where to position a tooltip relative to this panel.

properties.name: transform

values.name: rotate3d()
values.description: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

values.name: rotateX('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

values.name: rotateY('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

values.name: rotateZ('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

values.name: scale3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

values.name: scaleX()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleY()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleZ()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

values.name: translate3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

values.name: translateX()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

values.name: translateY()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

values.name: translateZ()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

properties.description: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

properties.name: transform-origin
properties.description: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

properties.name: transition

values.name: none
values.description: No property will transition.

properties.description: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

properties.name: transition-delay
properties.description: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

properties.name: transition-duration
properties.description: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

properties.name: transition-property

values.name: none
values.description: No property will transition.

properties.description: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

properties.name: transition-timing-function
properties.description: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

properties.name: ui-scale
properties.description: Specifies a scale to apply to this panel's layout and all descendants. This scale happens at the layout level ratherthan the bitmap level, so things like text will increase their font size rather than just bitmap scaling.

properties.name: ui-scale-x
properties.description: Specifies a X scale to apply to this panel's layout and all descendants. This scale happens at the layout level ratherthan the bitmap level, so things like text will increase their font size rather than just bitmap scaling.

properties.name: ui-scale-y
properties.description: Specifies a Y scale to apply to this panel's layout and all descendants. This scale happens at the layout level ratherthan the bitmap level, so things like text will increase their font size rather than just bitmap scaling.

properties.name: ui-scale-z
properties.description: Specifies a Z scale to apply to this panel's layout and all descendants. This scale happens at the layout level ratherthan the bitmap level, so things like text will increase their font size rather than just bitmap scaling.

properties.name: vertical-align

values.name: bottom
values.description: Align the bottom edge of the extended inline box with the bottom-edge of the line box.

values.name: center
values.description: Align the center baseline of the inline element with the center baseline of the parent.

values.name: center_nopixelsnap
values.description: Align the center baseline of the inline element with the center baseline of the parent, but does not round to an integer (pixel).

values.name: middle
values.description: Align the center baseline of the inline element with the center baseline of the parent.

values.name: top
values.description: Align the top edge of the extended inline box with the top-edge of the line box.

properties.description: Affects the vertical positioning of the inline boxes generated by an inline-level element inside a line box.

properties.name: visibility

values.name: collapse
values.description: Panel is invisible and not included in layout (does not keep its dimensions).

values.name: visible
values.description: (default) Panel is visible and included in layout.

properties.description: Specifies whether the boxes generated by an element are rendered. Invisible boxes still affect layout (set the display property to none to suppress box generation altogether).

properties.name: wash-color
properties.description: Specifies a 'wash' color, which means a color that will be blended over the panel and all it's children at composition time, tinting them. The alpha value of the color determines the intensity of the tinting.

properties.name: wash-color-fast
properties.description: Specifies a 'wash' color, which means a color that will be blended over the panel and all it's children at composition time, tinting them. The alpha value of the color determines the intensity of the tinting.

properties.name: white-space

values.name: normal
values.description: Sets 'white-space-collapsing' to 'collapse' and 'text-wrap' to 'normal'.

values.name: nowrap
values.description: Sets 'white-space-collapsing' to 'collapse' and 'text-wrap' to 'none'.

properties.description: Shorthand property for the 'white-space-collapsing' and 'text-wrap' properties.

properties.name: width

values.name: fit-children
values.description: (default) Panel size is set to the required size of all children. Can be specified in pixels or percentage.

values.name: fill-parent-flow()
values.description: (default) Fills to remaining parent height. If multiple children are set to this value, weight is used to determine final height.

values.name: height-percentage()
values.description: (default) Percentage of the panel's height, which allows you to enforce a particular aspect ratio.

properties.description: Specifies the width of the content area, padding area or border area (depending on 'box-sizing') of certain boxes.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Sets the x position for a panel, in pixels. Defaults to 0. Must not be in a flowing layout.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Sets the y position for a panel, in pixels. Defaults to 0. Must not be in a flowing layout.

properties.name: z
properties.description: Sets the z position for a panel, in pixels. Defaults to 0. Must not be in a flowing layout.

properties.name: z-index
properties.description: Sets the z-index for a panel, panels will be sorted and painted in order within a parent panel. The sorting first sorts by the z-pos computed from position and transforms, then if panels have matching zpos zindex is used. z-index is different than z-pos in that it doesn't affect rendering perspective, just paint/hit-test ordering.

atDirectives.name: @define
atDirectives.description: Defines a variable in CSS. Deprecated over variables if using SCSS.

atDirectives.name: @keyframes
atDirectives.description: Defines set of animation key frames.

pseudoClasses.name: :activationdisabled
pseudoClasses.description: Applies while the panel is disabled for activation. May still be enabled for focus (normal disabled disallows all input/focus).

pseudoClasses.name: :active
pseudoClasses.description: Applies while panel is being actively used (mouse-down on the panel).

pseudoClasses.name: :descendantfocus
pseudoClasses.description: Applies while a descendant of the panel has keyboard focus.

pseudoClasses.name: :focus
pseudoClasses.description: Applies while the panel has keyboard focus.

pseudoClasses.name: :hover
pseudoClasses.description: Applies while the user's mouse is over the panel.

pseudoClasses.name: :inspect
pseudoClasses.description: Applies while the panel is being inspected by the debugger.

pseudoClasses.name: :layoutfailed
pseudoClasses.description: Applies when the panel failed to load requested layout file.

pseudoClasses.name: :layoutloading
pseudoClasses.description: Applies when while panel is in-progress loading it's layout file.

pseudoClasses.name: :parentdisabled
pseudoClasses.description: Applies while a parent of this panel is disabled, thus implicitly disabling it.

pseudoClasses.name: :selected
pseudoClasses.description: Applies while the panel is selected.

pseudoClasses.name: :not()
pseudoClasses.description: The negation pseudo-class, :not(X), is a functional notation taking a simple selector (excluding the negation pseudo-class itself) as an argument. It represents an element that is not represented by its argument.
